abstract: Malcolm Turnbull, Australia’s prime minister since September, visits Indonesia for meeting with Pres Joko Widodo to mend diplomatic relations; human smuggling, refugees and other issues have raised discord between two countries.
lead_paragraph: Relations plummeted this year over issues like human smuggling, asylum seekers and the executions of Australian drug offenders.

headline.main: Malcolm Turnbull of Australia and Joko Widodo of Indonesia Seek to Mend Ties
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; Indonesia: Australia Aims to Mend Ties

snippet: Relations plummeted this year over issues like human smuggling, asylum seekers and the executions of Australian drug offenders.
